title: Queen of All Saints Geography/History Course: Grade 8
subject: Geography/History

document.title: Queen of All Saints Curriculum Book

225FC59B2F4D4222AA93DABC154B6F3C.description: Compare the geographical features of Australia and Papua New Guinea.

06A3418CA5E9459383806359A611D7F9.description: Compare the cultural and physical geography of Lebanon and Iran.

5F84EF73E7F64FD3B33635CAA7EEB5AB.description: Compare the human and physical geography of the Nile River Basin and the Sahara Desert.

BA1662DB81744B20AE99F4CCCE9ECF53.description: Analyze and compare the human and physical geography of a small area in Canada and Mexico.

1B0D0672B1FE42B4B859D79EF6DBD19C.description: Compare the human and geographical features of a small area in Western Europe and in Eastern Europe.

BE524C93A72343D18794F3090236E9CE.description: Compare the geographical similarities and differences between two countries in different regions or places within the same region, focusing on the major country studied.

B4656F7D594940CCBE711B47AFD123F2.description: Analyze the effects of the Himalayas on the climate, biogeography, and cultures of surrounding countries.

76F180DA776644DA9D5196D3BFE37E33.description: Evaluate the impact of physical geography on everyday activities in the Amazon Basin.

AED77F07BADA4859BF76664D1FA229D4.description: Identify the environmental and physical geography of the Caribbean Islands.

707EFCB029A7436DAD54E54EA88490DD.description: Know that the Grand Canyon is one of the seven natural wonders of the world and is located in Arizona.

44AA6307756843FEAE58DE3C4C4B58CB.description: Identify one or two key aspects of the biogeography, physical or cultural geography of a major country in each region studied.

495CD47B01F644B086E4DEF044066B85.description: Spell the states and capitals of Australia, New Zealand, Antarctica.

67B1ACDA5903400A88D5DB914E60C297.description: Spell the states and capitals of Southeast Asian Islands and Micronesia, Melanesia, and Polynesia.

46BD48DE81224B8488014B4474551B5C.description: Spell the states and capitals of South East Asia.

DD97F2A604B5497081F06A8EBFE36BFA.description: Spell the states and capitals of East Asia.

E15D9DE60AE24D69933A6FDB7F12CABE.description: Spell the states and capitals of South Asia.

186F577E8DFB42B6976FC579EA7909EC.description: Spell the states and capitals of Former Soviet Union States.

BD6F338B817542F4AD4604F272F63D84.description: Spell the states and capitals of Arabian Peninsula and Middle Eastern Core.

C8214623DD964A7BA4A9BD962DA88C99.description: Spell the states and capitals of North Africa and Mountainous Giants.

0B954D48F8AA423CB14F21DA4D480DFD.description: Spell the states and capitals of East Africa.

ED0632BB4D1D46359088528C5033250E.description: Spell the states and capitals of Central and South Africa.

7CFE3322EBF34F30AF1DD563F475D5F9.description: Spell the states and capitals of Western Africa.

FAC9771C2CB44E8EA87197C37E124D8B.description: Spell the states and capitals of Central and South America.

022B52767E0844369AA7A185D53D51A7.description: Spell the states and capitals of North America  and the Caribbean.

D4F1A912B4DD43BEBC184E707D91BF88.description: Spell the countries and capitals of the Former Soviet Republics and Former Soviet Satellites.

2C3B20CC4C1949F08956E5D64D0197A9.description: Spell the countries and capitals of Russia and the Balkan States.

73944CA34F4A4776AE2CCC5A8D2A16CD.description: Spell the countries and capitals of the British Isles and West-Central Europe.

15BD0B5A58604941B6BF950B62B91EDF.description: Spell the countries and capitals of the Mediterranean and Nordic Regions.

777BB0DC2851473F8120EBD4EDCC98A4.description: Spell the names of countries/capitals correctly.

8AE5A9E047214333936BDF39580F51EE.description: Spell the states and capitals of Southern states, Plains states, Rocky Mountain states, Pacific states

A0EA6915442C47B89B8C5EF111BE7E62.description: Spell the New England states, the Mid-Atlantic states, the Great Lakes states, and the Southwestern states and their capitals on a map.

98D16443F5C1461EB330507F15E3352E.description: Spell the states/capitals of the US correctly.

3260AA92BD684030822BB20A0A4C2C4A.description: Locate the states and capitals of Australia, New Zealand, Antarctica.

25D8694F055E46B0A34C613B9D51F597.description: Locate the states and capitals of Southeast Asian Islands and Micronesia, Melanesia, and Polynesia.

497435B439B54478AEDA433B88228AB9.description: Locate the states and capitals of South East Asia.

1F2EA26B11BA4139B7A0D9DCD6D94EA8.description: Locate the states and capitals of East Asia.

3E23B28A61F647109F56046996DD2F63.description: Locate the states and capitals of South Asia.

E14427DDFD1C4EDEAC60FC63AB0E8911.description: Locate the states and capitals of Former Soviet Union States.

2705671115934AA29199341407223618.description: Locate the states and capitals of Arabian Peninsula and Middle Eastern Core.

2DDFD3B611FD4445A7B99001A76C1D1E.description: Locate the states and capitals of North Africa and Mountainous Giants.

B38B7107A7A54A18B90E39FD8E40123C.description: Locate the states and capitals of East Africa.

2E30783E8C8F4B7697D3D707DBA0C3F1.description: Locate the states and capitals of Central and South Africa.

CD35B4D91A4F47CAA5DECA05944CDF5C.description: Locate the states and capitals of Western Africa.

22495E9979914FBF82B067C9221F4424.description: Locate the states and capitals of Central and South America.

FED2A861D316448A9D908216759C84B5.description: Locate the states and capitals of North America  and the Caribbean.

5BE8E2DEFC5049FDA96C48997C625596.description: Locate the countries and capitals of the Former Soviet Republics and Former Soviet Satellites.

09B88AB11DC2428587FFDD418CB31F28.description: Locate the countries and capitals of Russia and the Balkan States.

10750A6F0B8B42FB9A0234A0D86EEB31.description: Locate the countries and capitals of the British Isles and West-Central Europe.

EF4AA3980C234FF69972BE7821A1584F.description: Locate the countries and capitals of the Mediterranean and Nordic Regions.

2FDCEFD95C394BEBB18F7DD28B899710.description: Know the location of all countries and be able to name their capitals.

9F1A843161584CECA343D3963AC6E5C2.description: Locate the states and capitals of Southern states, Plains states, Rocky Mountain states, Pacific states

039818FC068D47CC9C5DBCE23A86F64E.description: Locate the New England states, the Mid-Atlantic states, the Great Lakes states, and the Southwestern states and their capitals on a map.

D75C14558B6146B98E9B047802A33D10.description: Know the location of the U.S. states and be able to name their capitals.

FE89CF993DD14563A273436D201B88CB.description: Explain the cultural and artistic achievements during the age of Louis XIV, including the construction of Versailles and the founding of Louisiana.

66AD21626F854776B07F3921D44E199E.description: Describe the reign of Louis XIV, including his decision to rule without a prime minister, the establishment of autocracy, and the theory of the Divine Right of Kings.

ACFF75D41E85426E9B223BF5D53E9877.description: Describe the outcomes of the Glorious Revolution, including the Declaration of Rights and the establishment of William and Mary as monarchs, as well as the early Jacobite revolts.

6B799F143CDD466A864CF0DE93EBBF42.description: Explain the causes and key events of the Glorious Revolution, including the conflicts during James II’s reign and the invitation to William of Orange.

8DA29EA2FE034DF598DAB5B7B92B28C2.description: Explain the causes, key events, and outcomes of the Great Rebellion, including the trial and execution of Charles I and the establishment of the Commonwealth.

EAB7EC137E14450D87CCBF08ECBDC7C2.description: Europe Before the Flood: Understand the political and religious upheavals in Europe leading up to the early modern period, including the conflicts in England and the rise of absolutism in France.

F24E29047B6641E7AC4CE2657E9394D1.description: Describe the key phases of the war, including the involvement of Christian IV of Denmark, Gustavus Adolphus of Sweden, Richelieu and France, and the outcomes such as the Peace of Westphalia and its impact on Europe.

F3B4500ADE8743588031471EDFB7BCEF.description: Explain the causes and key events of the Thirty Years’ War, including the dispute over the crown of Bohemia, the Defenestration of Prague, and the Bohemian Revolt.

12DAC2DE16234D799347C67BCF815F99.description: Analyze the significance of the Battle of Lepanto in halting the Turkish advance and its impact on European and Ottoman relations.

4E50C84C954B46E39B04A9491162971C.description: Explain the significant contributions of the Jesuits, including the missionary work of St. Francis Xavier and the educational and theological efforts of St. Peter Canisius.

7C319C26CF104F938424115E6830149C.description: Describe St. Ignatius’s early life, conversion, and the formation of the Society of Jesus, including his gathering of followers and the approval of the order.

7932B88B70B3461F8AE3E35F8F1EA099.description: Describe the accomplishments of the Council of Trent, including the reaffirmation of Catholic doctrines and the reforms implemented to address Church abuses.

28CEFE4F9A184E948CF2FF74B8D7C6E4.description: Explain the key sessions of the Council of Trent and the major topics discussed during these sessions.

C4BDFA704663461BBE77E48D7923723B.description: Catholic Renewal and Religious War: Understand the Catholic Church’s response to the Reformation, including significant religious, military, and political events in Europe during this period.

E744038F2FF14D4B8C02586AF7ECAFBA.description: Analyze the changes in the English Church under Henry VIII, Edward VI, Mary I, and Elizabeth I, including the impact of the Oath of Supremacy, the martyrdoms of St. John Fisher and St. Thomas More, and the persecution of Catholics.

095E8F948D374CD2B450E6DEF548B280.description: Describe the events leading to Henry VIII's break with the Catholic Church, including his marriage to Catherine of Aragon and the subsequent annulment.

22EDD293FE934F0DB82D60314EAEA8C5.description: Evaluate the influence of John Calvin and his role in the spread of Reformed Christianity.

FE1BBA9F8CE940279FC2F9E84896A801.description: Explain the contributions and beliefs of religious radicals in Wittenberg, including Ulrich Zwingli and the Anabaptists.

B5D2FEB5567A43C0B991640A0C87186B.description: Describe the events leading to Martin Luther's Ninety-five Theses, his excommunication by Pope Leo X, and his condemnation by the Diet of Worms.

A83DBF133C0F4A538A213CB9F8DC8806.description: The Protestant Reformation: Understand and explain the causes, key figures, and consequences of the Protestant Reformation and its impact on European religion and politics.

D9B5512A97CC411AACFFB5F5C429A318.description: Explain the significance of Portuguese explorations, including reaching India, and the impact of Columbus's discovery of America.

7B11CC27B7224E5B9B0AFBB943290582.description: Describe the marriage of Isabel of Castile and Fernando of Aragon and its significance for the reconquest of Granada and the unification of Spain.

BE0C655609E94311823D599862711334.description: Evaluate the role of the printing press in facilitating the Renaissance and the Reformation.

946CB85E5CB943BF9F05B2D630FE32E0.description: Explain the significance of Gutenberg's invention of the printing press and its impact on the spread of knowledge and literacy in Europe.

01D5D0929537412D8B16933E2AF4FF2F.description: Describe the key events leading to the Ottoman conquest of the Balkans, including the Battle of Kosovo and the siege and fall of Constantinople.

A74313A55E114C6A9D8D17F2D360A624.description: Evaluate the effects of humanism on politics, religion, morality, and economics, including the influence of Niccolò Machiavelli.

5F6DF48175F741038F8A1D74801B3DA9.description: Analyze the relationship between humanism and the Christian faith, including the contributions of figures like Petrarch.

47AB1B484ECE41F5A88C5F8FC285BCA0.description: Explain the influence of humanism on the Renaissance and its effects on European society.

3ECF865BD6514CF5912F214C3DEB5803.description: Compare and contrast the characteristics of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance in terms of art, culture, and intellectual thought.

CDD1382BD60147A6B4918A6102EBAE3B.description: The Birth of a New World: Understand and explain the transition from the medieval period to the Renaissance and the early modern era, including the cultural, political, and technological changes.

6D77AF65A6404A9A9F758DD3C9A97254.description: Evaluate the rise of the House of Tudor following the defeat of Richard III at Bosworth Field and the establishment of Henry VII's reign.

46835FB8290E452090BDE8BFEB16CD3A.description: Explain the causes and events of the Wars of the Roses, including the roles of key figures such as Duke Richard of York, King Henry VI, and Edward VI.

0FC31434B65C42458D9B19B6FD998BD3.description: Analyze the roles of significant figures such as Edward III, Henry V, and St. Joan of Arc, and evaluate the outcomes and consequences of the war for both France and England.

A0C73ADF0CB0404FA7C6D4D4FB2C70FD.description: Describe the causes and key events of the Hundred Years’ War, including disputes between the kings of France and England, major battles, and treaties.

3451B7A5111E41E89025A726F11DD419.description: Two Centuries of Conflict: Understand and explain the major conflicts in Europe during the late Middle Ages and their impact on European political and social structures.

8610A1F4A9D84F0ABF0094946F5A6A89.description: Evaluate the efforts to resolve the schism, such as the Council of Pisa and the Council of Constance, and their impact on the Church, including the influence of John Hus and the effects of the Black Death.

60F92023BC0D494FB65A8D4C7B523977.description: Explain the causes and consequences of the Great Schism, including the election of Pope Urban VI, the establishment of an antipope at Avignon, and the division within Christendom.

8291FB7B66D544109F832161A0424D6A.description: Analyze the significance of the "Babylonian Captivity" of the Church, the papal court at Avignon, and the subsequent abuses within the Church, including the influence of figures like John Wycliffe and St. Catherine of Sienna.

1EB3378BDDC14AB8B259814EEC9D5C8F.description: Describe the conflict between King Philip the Fair and Pope Boniface VIII, including the incident at Anagni.

83BF3620A72E467F86D7D54881D11ABA.description: Decline and Decay of the Middle Ages: Understand and explain the political, religious, and social crises that contributed to the decline of the medieval period.

6129AF3F3ECA4E3CA8EBEB9AEF06A375.description: Explain the contributions of St. Bonaventure and St. Thomas Aquinas to theology and philosophy.

2DBD60F8044B4F9EB1EB7FAAA0DE9032.description: Describe the influence of Aristotelianism in medieval universities and its role in shaping scholastic thought.

EFF290CCB0C742D4BEAEE3A42F1A9F27.description: Evaluate the contributions of St. Dominic and the Order of Preachers to the religious and intellectual life of medieval Europe.

E5CE3F92A4CA45DC9FB9F6824EE2C82C.description: Analyze the life and impact of St. Francis of Assisi and the establishment of the Friars Minor.

A1C2CB8431A94424BBB7B24EA4FD29F1.description: Explain the rise of universities and their role in fostering intellectual growth and innovation.

7F7D8B188E984DB1A4B2BB06A913ED54.description: Describe the characteristics and significance of Romanesque and Gothic architecture in medieval Europe.

A00C5EAE41A64586AA613A1A0B076D24.description: The Great Century : Understand and explain the cultural, intellectual, and religious developments during the high Middle Ages and their lasting impact on European civilization.

2EADFE66C07D4425B7678F94E8B52E29.description: Analyze the political, economic, and cultural impacts of the Crusades on Europe and the Middle East.

27E7BC66F1254DFDAFDF8B90D60564C0.description: Explain the fall of the last Christian kingdom in Palestine and the end of the Crusading efforts.

F1470A953114448F996F1602F833D4AC.description: Describe the Seventh and Eighth Crusades led by Louis IX, including his death in Tunis.

CABF93B7E8394EB4BEE7BE9B086DD94C.description: Evaluate Richard the Lion-Heart's failure to deliver Jerusalem and the significance of his treaty with Saladin.

D9DA3B52D6C9458BA1FA2D2C8FF945AD.description: Analyze the roles of Richard the Lion-Heart and Philip Augustus in the Third Crusade, including their capture of Acre and the battles against Saladin.

1DCF94DCAF324440968D637AEE10E81A.description: Explain the events and outcomes of the Peasants’ Crusade and the First Crusade, including the conquest of Jerusalem.

64FC544AD06F49858C14C175C255C2C3.description: Describe the conquests of the Seljuk Turks and the circumstances leading to Pope Urban II calling for a crusade.

F08BF5649BC344D185AB964E31333211.description: The Crusades : Understand and explain the causes, events, and consequences of the Crusades and their impact on both the Christian and Islamic worlds.

D5CE8527BBB54C47A4C1D5A0EA7777AE.description: Students should be able to summarize a discussion using the summarizer sentence frames.

335DFFC775844D60AAC3B7C54FA85D09.description: Students should be able to challenge an opinion during a discussion using the challenger sentence frames.

B3EBC28F66604918855F592640BF49FF.description: Students should be able to build on an opinion during a discussion using the builder sentence frames.

E7565F69DEFC4A4E9AD533BF6AB6AA77.description: Students should start a discussion using the instigator sentence frames.

FD3A3755813D4E448DAF943A0922F2AD.description: Students should develop “Habits of Discussion” using the different topics covered during history class.

72A2509CDE8348C3B4B12EEB949F8EEE.description: Students should be able to draw a practical lesson of conduct from historical events and actions using the VIP (Virtue-Impact-Practice) method and sentence frames.

84482A1FC6454481BBD6D2C4091F7499.description: Students should be able to judge the morality of historical personages and actions using the CER (Claim-Evidence-Reasoning) method and a sentence frame.

5D247A86D9C342208A4B90D8004FD05B.description: Students should be able to judge the causes and effects of historical events using the CER (Claim-Evidence-Reasoning) method and a sentence frame. They should be able to formulate and write this response in 5 minutes.

51952B6BB1B043DCB5F666658EA4302F.description: Students should be able to judge the causes and effects of historical events using the CER (Claim-Evidence-Reasoning) method and a sentence frame.
